title: 1.16 Exodus IV: Origins of the Old Israelite Religion
itunes:title: Exodus IV: Origins of the Old Israelite Religion
description: The major festivals of Judaism are created, the Tent of Meeting is designed, and the priesthood under Aaron established. God is outraged when the feckless Aaron makes two idols, but in an astonishing display of nepotism, Moses lets Aaron off the hook and instead consigns 3,000 Israelites to death. We also find the real Ten Commandments: they are not what you think.
content:encoded: The major festivals of Judaism are created, the Tent of Meeting is designed, and the priesthood under Aaron established. God is outraged when the feckless Aaron makes two idols, but in an astonishing display of nepotism, Moses lets Aaron off the hook and instead consigns 3,000 Israelites to death. We also find the real Ten Commandments: they are not what you think.
itunes:subtitle: In this episode Moses creates the major festivals of Judaism, the Tent of Meeting, and the priesthood.
itunes:author: Garry Stevens
